arm_group.description: Each AIT session consisted a 10 minute warm-up period followed by 16 minutes of interval training consisting of intervals of 4-3-2 and 1 minutes duration at 85-95% of their peak capacity separated by 2-4 min active rest.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to examine the effects of high intensity aerobic interval training
      (AIT) versus moderate continuous training (CON) in heart transplant recipients.

clinical_study.brief_title: High-intensity Interval Training Versus Moderate Continuous Training in Heart Transplant Recipients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Clinically stable heart transplant recipients > 12 month or more after HTx, age > 18 years,
      willing and capable of giving written informed consent for study participation and
      anticipated to be able to participate in the study for 12 months were included from the
      Heart Centre, Rigshospitalet, Copenhagen University Hospital.

      Patients were excluded due to unstable condition or postoperative complications, recent
      severe rejection episodes (>H1R < 3 month), physical disabilities which prevent
      participation and re-transplantation or multi-organtransplantation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        -stable Heart transplant recipients > 12 month or more after HTx, age > 18 years,< 80.
        willing and capable of giving written informed consent for study participation.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        unstable condition postoperative complications, recent severe rejection episodes (>H1R < 3
        month), re-transplantation or multi-organtransplantation.

intervention.description: Each AIT session consisted a 10 minute warm-up period followed by 16 minutes of interval training consisting of intervals of 4-3-2 and 1 minutes duration at 85-95% of their peak capacity separated by 2-4 min active rest.

clinical_study.official_title: High-intensity Interval Training Versus Moderate Continuous Training in Heart Transplant Recipients With Impaired Chronotropic Response: A Randomized Controlled Crossover Trial.

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: Danish Health and Medicines Authority

primary_outcome.description:
baseline test before randomization
follow-up after 12 weeks of exercise
follow-up after 5 month washout.
follow-up after second 12 weeks period of exercise.
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline test (inclusion), follow-up 1(3 month), follow-up 2 (8 month), follow-up 3 (11 month).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: After the release of the cuff the hyperemic response was recorded and the reactive hyperemia index (RHI) was calculated automatic independent of operator. (endoPAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline test (inclusion), follow-up 1(3 month), follow-up 2 (8 month), follow-up 3 (11 month).

secondary_outcome.description: SF-36, information on Quality of Life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline test (inclusion), follow-up 1(3 month), follow-up 2 (8 month), follow-up 3 (11 month).

secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms of anxiety and depression measured by the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline test (inclusion), follow-up 1(3 month), follow-up 2 (8 month), follow-up 3 (11 month).

secondary_outcome.description: Samples cooled on ice, centrifuged for 10 minutes and the plasma transferred to microtubes and stored at -80°C. Biomarkers analysed at department of biomedicine at University of Copenhagen.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline test (inclusion), follow-up 1(3 month), follow-up 2 (8 month), follow-up 3 (11 month).

secondary_outcome.description: Augmentation index (AI)derived from pulse wave analyses and is a measure of arterial stiffness, (EndoPAT).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline test (inclusion), follow-up 1(3 month), follow-up 2 (8 month), follow-up 3 (11 month).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
